conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true isometric/cutaway 3D model: walls have clear height and thickness, multiple wall faces are visible, and the ceiling/roof is removed to expose interior spaces.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Strong 3D extrusion with readable wall thickness and interior volume; angled/isometric view is correct; cutaway is clean though some wall tops/edges appear slightly stylized rather than strictly architectural.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall massing and main zoning (central living/dining, adjacent kitchen, bedrooms around perimeter) generally match, but several exact partitions/opening placements and some ancillary spaces (decks/balconies/utility/baths) are not perfectly traceable to the 2D plan at this resolution.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture is present (sofa/living setup, dining table, multiple beds). Kitchen is modeled with counters/appliances; bathrooms exist but fixtures are simplified and not all wet areas clearly correspond one-to-one with the plan.

visual_clarity.notes: Clean presentation with good lighting and readable walls/floors; minor shadowing and stylized materials reduce strict geometric legibility of some openings; background is clean and no text/UI clutter is present.

detected_errors.description: Some room boundaries/ancillary spaces (notably balconies/decks and certain bath/utility partitions) are not perfectly faithful to the 2D plan, suggesting mild-to-moderate layout drift.
Door/window exact positions and sizes cannot be confirmed as fully matching the 2D plan; openings appear plausible but not strictly verifiable against all indicated locations.

summary: A clearly valid 3D cutaway conversion with strong spatial readability, but with moderate fidelity gaps in exact partitioning and opening/ancillary-space alignment versus the 2D plan.
